description: Possibly from entice, as below, suggesting the bowler's purpose.

entries.meaning: (cricket, dated) A ball bowled to strike the ground about a bat's length in front of the wicket; a yorker.
examples: Bowlers should practise both toss and tice.

entries.meaning: (croquet) A ball left at a hittable but difficult distance or position, to lure the opponent into a mistake.

verbs.description: tice (third-person singular simple present tices, present participle ticing, simple past and past participle ticed)
